title: Bardella heads the third-largest group of the EU Parliament, Patriots for Europe
summary: On Monday, the far-right Rassemblement National joined a group that includes Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban's Fidesz and Austria's far-right FPÖ party. With 84 MEPs, it ranks behind the Christian Democrats of the European People's Party and the Social Democrats, but ahead of the liberals of Renew.

title: Carla Bruni-Sarkozy charged in husband's witness tampering case
summary: Nicolas Sarkozy's wife is closely connected to Mimi Marchand, a prominent figure in the celebrity press who is suspected of orchestrating the retraction of a key witness in the case of Sarkozy's suspected Libyan campaign financing.

title: Euro 2024: Spain beats France 2-1 to reach final
summary: 'They were superior in terms of control and technique,' French coach Didier Deschamps said. Spain, which is chasing a record fourth European Championship title, will play England or the Netherlands in the final on Sunday in Berlin.

title: Eight killed after Beryl sweeps across US
summary: At least seven people died in the storm in Texas, with another person killed in neighboring Louisiana, authorities said. Millions in the Houston area remain without power.

title: Europe's new Ariane 6 rocket releases satellites, marking successful first launch
summary: On Tuesday, the much-delayed inaugural flight of the European Space Agency's most powerful rocket yet launched from Europe's spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana. The take-off is hoped to bring an end to a difficult time for European space efforts.

title: French elections: Compose your own majority with our coalition simulator
summary: 289 seats are necessary to achieve an absolute majority in France's Assemblée Nationale.

title: French investigators probe Le Pen's 2022 campaign finances
summary: The investigation is looking into allegations of embezzlement, forgery, fraud, and of a candidate on an electoral campaign accepted a loan, the Paris prosecutor's office said.

title: Russia issues warrant for exiled opposition figure Yulia Navalnaya
summary: The economist, opposition figure and wife of main Putin opponent Alexei Navalny was accused of participating in an 'extremist organization' by Moscow.

title: NATO allies pledge long-term support for Ukraine, but stop short of membership
summary: The Alliance's 32 members are set to strengthen support for Ukraine's air defense systems at the Washington summit from July 9 to 11, but the prospect of membership remains out of reach.

title: French elections: European leaders relieved far right lost, concerned by political uncertainty
summary: Germany, Spain and Poland were delighted that the far-right Rassemblement National party was blocked by the left in France's elections on Sunday. But many in the EU are worried about the risk of a deadlock in France.

title: Two French rugby players detained in Argentina over alleged sex assault
summary: Hugo Auradou and Oscar Jégou, who played in France's Test victory over Argentina on Saturday, will be taken to Mendoza where the alleged attack took place.

title: Short of Wembanyama, Les Bleus lose to Germany in Olympic warm-up match
summary: Without their prodigy, who had to withdraw due to a 'viral illness,' Les Bleus lost to the Germans (65-70). It was a disappointing defeat 18 days before their Olympic debut.

title: Alec Baldwin manslaughter trial over 'Rust' shooting begins
summary: The star of 'The Hunt for Red October' made his first appearance in the courtroom on Monday, when Judge Mary Marlowe Summer, in a significant victory for the defense, ruled at a pretrial hearing that Baldwin's role as a co-producer on Rust isn't relevant to the trial.

title: A politically charged South American presence at the Festival d'Avignon
summary: One-third of the theater festival's program will be performed in Spanish and will feature the works of Tamara Cubas, Tiziano Cruz and Malicho Vaca Valenzuela who explore the history and aesthetics of the body.

title: Inside the secrets of generative AI
summary: The French-American startup Hugging Face recently made the most powerful corpus of texts for developing language models available on its open-source platform.

title: Russia under fire at UN security council over Ukraine strikes
summary: Over 30 people died at Ohmatdyt Children's Hospital in Kyiv on Monday after a salvo of Russian missiles fell on Ukraine.

title: Age, gender, profession: Who are France's new members of Parliament?
summary: Only 208 women will sit in the Assemblée Nationale, representing just over a third of all MPs. This is the second time in two years that the proportion of women in the Assemblée has fallen.

title: Watch France's second round of elections, recapped
summary: The left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire alliance, who came out on top in the second round of the legislative elections on Sunday, says it is ready to govern – although it lacks an absolute majority. But President Macron has not yet chosen a prime minister.

title: Ukraine reels after one of Russia's deadliest air attacks
summary: On July 8, military and civilian targets across Ukraine were destroyed by Russian missiles, killing at least 41 people. These attacks reveal the deterioration of Ukraine's air defense.

title: In Brussels, some worry a 'paralyzed France' could no longer 'play the role of driving force'
summary: Within the EU institutions, after the relief of the RN's defeat, there is concern that, in the absence of a stable majority, Paris will lose its leading role among the 27 member states.

title: 'Orban's maneuvers, on both the European and international stage, are symptomatic of a general disorganization of Western leadership'
summary: The Hungarian prime minister is taking advantage of the weakness of the major Western leaders to play the troublemaker, both inside and outside the EU, as well as at NATO, while he attends its summit. It's a strategy that should not be underestimated, writes columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: French elections: Thorny negotiations on the left over choice of prime minister candidate
summary: Left-wing party leaders are holding meeting after meeting to try and reach a consensus on a candidate. On Tuesday, some of them called for a vote by Nouveau Front Populaire lawmakers to break the deadlock.

title: 'I Am: Céline Dion' on Prime Video: The painful journey of a voiceless diva
summary: Director Irene Taylor doesn't skimp on voyeurism to illustrate the singer's battle against a rare illness that affects her vocal cords and has prevented her from being on the stage since 2020.

title: Bardella faces first hurdle as head of Rassemblement National
summary: Voices within the far-right party are denouncing the young leader's strategic errors after a disappointing result in the legislative elections, citing problematic candidate choices and not enough presence on the ground.

title: France-Spain: A bitter end to the Euro for the outclassed Bleus
summary: Still a victim of their inefficiency and dependence on a struggling Kylian Mbappé, France lost (1-2) in the semi-finals to the far superior Spaniards. Their Euro performance will go down in history as unsatisfactory.

title: Macron's decision to maintain Attal government is contested on both left and right
summary: The French president has broken with the tradition of having a resigning government manage day-to-day matters after a change of majority in parliament. Instead, he has allowed ministers to retain all their prerogatives.

title: For Germany's Social Democrats, 'You can't govern in coalition without some give and take'
summary: In the wake of France's parliamentary elections, which failed to give any group an absolute majority, German MP Nils Schmid, the SPD foreign policy expert, talks about Germany's culture of compromise, which he believes is a prerequisite for forming a solid coalition.

title: The letters from two Ukrainian sisters: 'They say that during a war, women give birth to more boys than girls to compensate for losses. I'm yet another proof of it'
summary: Olga and Sasha Kurovska, two Ukrainian sisters, one of whom lives in Paris and the other in Kyiv, kept a diary for a year in Le Monde. The pair shared a personal account of how their daily lives were disrupted by the war. They now give updates about their lives in the form of regular correspondence.

title: The two Frances of July 7: The 'relief' of the left, the disillusionment of RN supporters
summary: From the Place de la République in Paris to the Canebière in Marseille, left-wing voters gathered to celebrate the unexpected score of the Nouveau Front Populaire alliance. RN members and sympathizers expressed their disappointment.

title: Drinking water in Paris and other European cities contaminated with an unmonitored 'forever chemical'
summary: Traces of TFA, an unregulated PFAS, have been detected in tap water and bottled water throughout Europe, according to analyses by the PAN Europe network.

title: French elections: Left-wing candidate registered on France's security watchlist elected to Parliament
summary: Raphaël Arnault of the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire alliance easily beat his far-right oponent. Not without controversy over his inclusion on the watchlist due to the anti-fascist collective he co-founded.

title: French elections: Meyer Habib, the voice of the Israeli right, loses seat
summary: The outspoken conservative lost to Renaissance candidate Caroline Yadan in a constituency representing a segment of French citizens living abroad.

title: With the successful launch of Ariane 6, Europe regains access to space
summary: The European rocket successfully completed its qualification flight on Tuesday, putting four years of delays behind it. The program will now have to offer attractive prices and win new orders from Elon Musk's competitors.

title: Modi shows closeness with Putin despite disagreements on Ukraine
summary: In Moscow, the Indian prime minister, a historic ally of Moscow and partner of the West, pleaded with the Russian president for 'a path to peace through dialogue.'

title: Microsoft gives up OpenAI board seat amid regulator scrutiny
summary: Microsoft's $13-billion tie-up with the ChatGPT maker has raised concerns about just how much influence it has over its smaller partner.

title: Israeli army urges all Gaza City residents to leave
summary: Israel dropped thousands of leaflets urging all residents to leave amid an intensified military offensive on the Palestinian territory's main city, an AFP journalist said

title: French elections: Macron's Renaissance group in the Assemblée is on the brink of splintering
summary: The parliamentary group is looking to plug holes in a sinking ship as some members lean towards an alliance with Les Républicains. Several MPs have announced that they will leave the group if this happens.

title: UK manhunt launched after 3 women killed with a crossbow
summary: The women killed were the daughters and wife of BBC racing commentator John Hunt. Police have announced a manhunt for suspect Kyle Clifford, 26, and warned the public not to approach him, as he may still be armed.

title: Rating agencies warn French government after election outcome
summary: According to S&P Global Ratings, the absence of a majority in the Assemblée Nationale could lead to economic stagnation.

title: Racism is increasing in the workplace in France
summary: Xenophobic physical and verbal attacks in the workplace have been on the rise in recent years. They have continued to intensify since the dissolution of the Assemblée Nationale, legitimized by the rise of the far right.

title: French elections: 'No one has won,' Macron says in letter to the French
summary: In his second statement since the results of France's snap parliamentary elections, President Emmanuel Macron calls on 'republican' forces to 'build a solid majority, necessarily plural.'

title: US elections: George Clooney calls on Joe Biden to 'step aside'
summary: The movie star and major Democratic Party fundraiser is the latest of a series of high-profile donors and political figures to call for Biden's withdrawal, after the president's June 27 debate against Donald Trump.

title: French police shoot and kill armed suspect in New Caledonia
summary: The death brings the death toll of almost two months of unrest in the French Pacific territory to 10.

title: Left-wing MP François Ruffin: 'I had to cut the rope with Jean-Luc Mélenchon to be able to breathe'
summary: In an interview, Ruffin explains why he left the radical-left La France Insoumise party. He also says that Emmanuel Macron 'must allow the left to govern, by appointing a prime minister from its ranks.'

title: Ukraine on an 'irreversible' path to NATO, US and Europe say
summary: Several leaders including US Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Czech President Petr Pavel, used the word 'irreversible' to describe the way forward for Ukraine as NATO members gathered for a summit in Washington on Wednesday. NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg underlined that Kyiv will be allowed to join the coalition after its war with Russia ends.
